findings.title: Unprotected constructor
findings.description: The constructor of a contract is unprotected, allowing anyone to call it and potentially causing unintended behavior.

findings.title: Unprotected function: poolLength
findings.description: The poolLength function is declared as external and does not have any access modifiers, making it accessible by anyone.

findings.title: Unauthorized script upgrade in setLanaPerSecond
findings.description: The function setLanaPerSecond allows unauthorized script upgrades.

findings.title: Unprotected function: add
findings.description: The 'add' function is declared as external and does not have any access modifiers, making it vulnerable to unauthorized calls.

findings.title: Unprotected function: set
findings.description: The 'set' function is unprotected and can be modified by anyone, potentially leading to unauthorized state changes.

findings.title: Unprotected function: getMultiplier
findings.description: The getMultiplier function is unprotected and can be exploited.

findings.title: Unprotected function: pendingLANA
findings.description: The function setLanaPerSecond allows the smart contract owner to change lana token reward per second without any protection.

findings.title: Unprotected function: massUpdatePools
findings.description: The massUpdatePools function is declared as public and does not have any access modifiers, making it vulnerable to unauthorized access.

findings.title: Unprotected function: updatePool
findings.description: The updatePool function is public and can be called by anyone, potentially leading to unauthorized modifications.

findings.title: Unprotected function: deposit
findings.description: The 'deposit' function is public and lacks access control, allowing anyone to call it.

findings.title: Unprotected function: withdraw
findings.description: The withdraw function allows a spender to withdraw a set number of tokens from a specified account without any protection mechanism.

findings.title: Unprotected function: emergencyWithdraw
findings.description: The emergencyWithdraw function is public and lacks access control, allowing anyone to call it.

findings.title: Reentrancy risk in safeLANATransfer
findings.description: The audit report does not provide a specific description of this finding.

findings.title: Reentrancy risk in checkSameOriginReentranted and checkSameSenderReentranted
findings.description: The functions checkSameOriginReentranted and checkSameSenderReentranted are vulnerable to reentrancy attacks.

findings.title: Unprotected function: epoch
findings.description: The 'epoch' function is declared as external and does not have any access modifiers or reentrancy protection.

findings.title: Unprotected function: nextEpochPoint
findings.description: The nextEpochPoint function is unprotected and can be accessed externally.

findings.title: Unprotected function: getLanaPrice
findings.description: The getLanaPrice function is declared as external and does not have any access modifiers, making it accessible by anyone.

findings.title: Unprotected function: buyBonds
findings.description: The buyBonds function is unprotected and can be exploited by an external attacker.

findings.title: Unprotected function: redeemBonds
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Centralization Risk: Smart contract owner can change lana token reward per second
findings.description: The smart contract owner has the power to modify the LANA token reward per second, posing a centralization risk.
